data.event: In 1652 it was mentioned as the seat of a district that also included Bukovo, Krtečne, Žabže, and Selc.
Most of the hamlet of Selc burned in 1935 because of a lightning strike.
During the Second World War, German forces burned two houses and a hayrack in Bukovo and looted the village on November 1, 1943.
The hamlet of Žabže was burned on June 10, 1944; during the attack, three men were killed and four women burned to death.
